title: Two identical objects one falling one thrown

content.question: Object 1 and object 2 travel across a horizontal surface, and their horizontal velocity as a function of time is shown in the graph. Which of the following statements is correct about the two-object system?

choices.label: The magnitude of acceleration for object 2 is greater than the magnitude of the acceleration of object 1.

After <math alttext="2 seconds " overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></math>, object 1 travels a greater distance than object 2 travels.

Object 1 and object 2 are at the same horizontal position at <math alttext="2 seconds " overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

After <math alttext="4 seconds " overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mtext>â€‰</mtext><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the speed of object 1 is greater than the speed of object 2.

content.answer: After <math alttext="2 seconds " overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></math>, object 1 travels a greater distance than object 2 travels.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
